column4: Where is the xorg.conf located on newer version of ubunut. Its not in /etc/X11/ anymore ?
X11 now auto configures your X server ,so only create a xorg.conf if you need some special
this annoys me, what reason would they have to take it away other than "they can"
So I can just add sections I need, I dont need to right a whole config ?
you can see what your X11 is using reading /var/log/Xorg.0.log
yes you can just add the section you need, indeed. If you needa full xorg.conf use X -configure
